metadata.Description: Energy democracy is a concept that promotes the democratization of energy systems, giving communities and individuals more control over the production, distribution, and consumption of energy.

entities.Description: Approaches and initiatives that are driven and implemented by local communities to address sustainable energy challenges and meet their specific needs.
Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.
Renewable energy generated from sources located in bodies of water, such as wind farms or tidal power plants.

relations.Description: Energy democracy addresses energy inequality by promoting equitable access to clean and affordable energy for all individuals and communities.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy employs participatory decision-making processes to ensure that all stakeholders have a voice in shaping energy policies and projects.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy collaborates with community-based organizations to empower local communities and facilitate their participation in the energy transition.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy supports the establishment and growth of renewable energy cooperatives, enabling communities to collectively own and benefit from renewable energy projects.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy administers feed-in tariff programs that incentivize the generation of renewable energy by allowing individuals and communities to sell excess electricity to the grid.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy measures energy equity by assessing the fairness and accessibility of energy systems and ensuring that no one is left behind in the energy transition.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 7 on affordable and clean energy, to contribute to the achievement of sustainable development targets.
relations.Subject: energy democracy

relations.Description: Energy democracy is an instance of the democratic energy transition, which aims to democratize energy systems and empower communities in shaping their energy future.
relations.Subject: energy democracy
energy and health
relations.Description: Energy and health implements building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: energy and health
relations.Description: Energy and health funds research on renewable energy to promote sustainable and clean energy sources.

relations.Subject: community-led solutions
relations.Description: Community-led solutions implement sustainable energy projects that aim to provide clean and affordable energy to local communities.

relations.Subject: community-led solutions
relations.Description: Community-led solutions focus on improving energy access in underserved areas by promoting the use of sustainable energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates provide funding for Clean Energy Research to support the development of innovative renewable energy technologies.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations.Subject: offshore renewable energy
relations.Description: Offshore renewable energy implements building standards that promote the use of sustainable energy sources and technologies.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
